text: Alexandre Laferrière at the International de Cinéma et d'Art. Alexandre Laferrière (born 1973) is a Canadian screenwriter known for working with director Maxime Giroux. Among his screenplays are Demain (2009) and Jo pour Jonathan (2010), directed by Giroux. In meeting with Giroux at cafes to discuss their next project, Giroux said "we'd see these women and men walking by and we just didn't know anything about them." This provided inspiration for their script Felix and Meira. Laferrière did much of the research. For the 2014 film, Laferrière won Best Screenplay at the Whistler Film Festival, and the Jutra Award for Best Screenplay. ==References== ==External links== *Alexandre Laferrière at the Internet Movie Database Category:1973 births Category:Canadian screenwriters Category:Canadian screenwriters in French Category:Living people
